intro: Chrysocephalum semipapposum subsp. occidentale, commonly known as the western golden everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as woodlands and grasslands. Its striking appearance makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
